intro: Lappago latipes, commonly known as the narrowleaf lappago, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender, aromatic leaves. The plant produces small, clustered white flowers that bloom in late spring. Its roots are often harvested for their medicinal properties, used in traditional remedies for digestive issues. Lappago latipes thrives in cool, humid climates and is typically found in rocky or forested areas.
